title: A Complete Guide to Changing an iLO Password

steps.title: Connect a keyboard, mouse and monitor to the back of the server.
steps.content: Connect a keyboard, mouse and monitor to the back of the server.

steps.title: Plug the server into a power source.
steps.content: Plug the server into a power source. If there are multiple slots for power cords, plug them all in.

steps.title: Connect the server to a router that has an internet connection.
steps.content: Connect the server to a router that has an internet connection.

steps.title: Power up the server while watching the monitor.
steps.content: Power up the server while watching the monitor. If the server was already on, turn it off and then on again.

steps.title: Wait for the message "Integrated lights-out server, press <f8> to continue."
steps.content: Wait for the message "Integrated lights-out server, press <f8> to continue." This will happen shortly after an HP Prolite graphic appears.

steps.title: Press F8 and go to Users.
steps.content: Press F8 and go to Users.

steps.title: Scroll down to Edit and select Administrator.
steps.content: Scroll down to Edit and select Administrator.

steps.title: Change the password as desired and press F10 to save.
steps.content: Change the password as desired and press F10 to save.

steps.title: Go to Network and select Information.
steps.content: Go to Network and select Information.

steps.title: Write down the IP address and press Esc to return to the previous menu.
steps.content: Write down the IP address and press Esc to return to the previous menu.

steps.title: Go to File and select Exit to quit.
steps.content: Go to File and select Exit to quit.

steps.title: On your computer, enter in the IP address that you wrote down into a browser and log in using the name Administrator and your new password.
steps.content: On your computer, enter in the IP address that you wrote down into a browser and log in using the name Administrator and your new password.

steps.title: Follow these steps to reset your password.
steps.content: Follow these steps to reset your password. Create a DOS bootable USB flash key NOTE: You can use HP USB Key Utility.

steps.title: Download the IPMItool from this link:
steps.content: Download the IPMItool from this link: https://sourceforge.net/projects/ipmitool/

steps.title: Copy the IPMItool.exe to the bootable disk.
steps.content: Copy the IPMItool.exe to the bootable disk.

steps.title: Boot the server using the bootable disk (check boot order in RBSU).
steps.content: Boot the server using the bootable disk (check boot order in RBSU).

steps.title: Run ipmitool.exe 20 18 47 03 02 61 64 6d 69 6e 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 #*NOTE:
steps.content: Run ipmitool.exe 20 18 47 03 02 61 64 6d 69 6e 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 #*NOTE: You can copy this command and paste to batch file. Example: run.bat in step 3

steps.title: Now the password for admin account should reset back to admin .
steps.content: Now the password for admin account should reset back to admin .
